data.title: ELLA FITZGERALD'S CHRISTMAS: COMPLETE 13 ARRANGEMENT SET [DOWNLOAD]: Arranged by Grace Price and Robert Black, Prepared by Jeffrey Sultanof and Rob DuBoff: Jazz Lines Publications
data.meta_description: Arranged by Grace Price and Robert Black, Prepared by Jeffrey Sultanof and Rob DuBoff: ELLA FITZGERALD'S CHRISTMAS: COMPLETE 13 ARRANGEMENT SET [DOWNLOAD], 13 Jazz Vocal Arrangements, Jazz Lines Publications and thousands more titles. ejazzlines has the
data.text:
Edition: 13 Jazz Vocal Arrangements

Description: Various Styles - Medium Easy

Publisher: Jazz Lines Publications

Regardless of one's personal religious backgrounds, Christmas hymns have an undeniable beauty to them that lends to the heavy nostalgia that they continue to invoke to this day. It should come as no surprise that vocalist Ella Fitzgerald was a natural when it came to interpreting these timeless songs.

Recorded in 1967, "Ella Fitzgerald's Christmas" would focus exclusively on hymns rather than the largely secular material of her earlier "Ella Wishes You a Swinging Christmas." Teaming up with arrangers Grace Price and Robert Black, and conducted by Ralph Carmichael, Fitzgerald sees herself accompanied by a mix of different configurations, ranging from small instrumental groups to full SATB choirs. These arrangements have an almost chamber-music feel to them at times, evoking a genteel warmth that is highly appropriate for the holiday season. Although hers could never be mistaken for an operatic voice, Fitzgerald's performances on each track showcase an unmistakable reverence for the source material in addition to her flawless intonation and naturally gorgeous voice. It is clear that these songs were important to Fitzgerald, and she treats them with an appropriate level of reverence.

This publication has been prepared from the original score and the set of parts used during the recording session. We hope that this arrangement provides you and your audience with holiday joy and happiness!

Here are the arrangements used by Ella Fitzgerald during her recording sessions for Ella Fitzgerald's Christmas, in a complete set at nearly 25% off of retail!

Regardless of one's personal religious backgrounds, Christmas hymns have an undeniable beauty to them that lends to the heavy nostalgia that they continue to invoke to this day. It should come as no surprise that vocalist Ella Fitzgerald was a natural when it came to interpreting these timeless songs.

Recorded in 1967, "Ella Fitzgerald's Christmas" would focus exclusively on hymns rather than the largely secular material of her earlier "Ella Wishes You a Swinging Christmas." Teaming up with arrangers Grace Price and Robert Black, and conducted by Ralph Carmichael, Fitzgerald sees herself accompanied by a mix of different configurations, ranging from small instrumental groups to full SATB choirs. These arrangements have an almost chamber-music feel to them at times, evoking a genteel warmth that is highly appropriate for the holiday season. Although hers could never be mistaken for an operatic voice, Fitzgerald's performances on each track showcase an unmistakable reverence for the source material in addition to her flawless intonation and naturally gorgeous voice. It is clear that these songs were important to Fitzgerald, and she treats them with an appropriate level of reverence.

These publications have been prepared from the original scores and the sets of parts used during the recording session. We hope that these arrangements provides you and your audience with holiday joy and happiness!

These are all also available individually, and please click on any title for more information on each, as there are various different instrumentations. We have listed the songs in the order in which they appeared on the record.

JLP-9663 O HOLY NIGHT

JLP-9749 IT CAME UPON A MIDNIGHT CLEAR

JLP-9717 HARK, THE HERALD ANGELS SING

JLP-9718 AWAY IN A MANGER

JLP-9754 JOY TO THE WORLD

JLP-9716 THE FIRST NOEL

JLP-9668 SILENT NIGHT

JLP-9667 O COME ALL YE FAITHFUL

JLP-9720 SLEEP, MY LITTLE JESUS

JLP-9719 ANGELS WE HAVE HEARD ON HIGH

JLP-9757 O LITTLE TOWN OF BETHLEHEM

JLP-9756 WE THREE KINGS
